This move follows global peers like Estee Lauder and The Body Shop, who are also exploring local production. India's luxury beauty market is projected to reach $4 billion by 2035. Local manufacturing offers advantages like lower duties. Several celebrity-owned brands are also seeking manufacturing partners in the country.

items.title: India faces challenges in local rare earth production amidst China's export restrictions
items.summary: India's ambitious Rs 7,300 crore plan to boost local rare earth magnet production faces a significant challenge. China, the global leader, has imposed new export controls on essential processing equipment. This move could impact India's self-sufficiency goals. While Germany and Japan offer alternatives, their equipment is considerably more expensive, potentially affecting project viability. The scheme is awaiting cabinet approval.

Its extensive workforce and burgeoning enthusiasm for the industry tackle the pressing global workforce shortages. The country is also preparing to launch its own major accounting firms, bolstered by alliances such as Allinial Global, which encourage collaborative efforts and exchange of best practices.

items.title: Homebuyers' body flags gaps in RERA, seeks protection from 'errant' builders
items.summary: A pan-India homebuyers' association has approached the Union housing ministry. They seek urgent intervention to fix critical gaps in the Real Estate Regulation and Development Act, 2016. The association highlights that buyers remain vulnerable to exploitation. They are calling for standard operating procedures to be issued to all state RERA authorities. This aims to restore homebuyer confidence and ensure compliance.

items.title: Global central banks cut US T-bill exposure, increase gold reserves
items.summary: Global central banks are reducing US Treasury holdings and increasing gold reserves. India's gold reserves surpassed $100 billion. Gold prices experienced a significant drop, which is expected to boost demand from investors and central banks. This shift indicates a diversification strategy amid political uncertainty. The trend shows a move away from dollar assets towards gold.

items.title: Low-end smartphones may get costlier as chipmakers shift focus to AI servers
items.summary: Entry-level and mid-range smartphones are poised to become more expensive from the fourth quarter due to surging memory chip prices. Manufacturers are diverting production to high-bandwidth memory for AI servers, shrinking supply and increasing costs for LPDDR4X and NAND flash storage. Brands may compromise on features or pass on these increased costs to consumers.

items.title: Festive cheer: Alcoholic beverage industry expects 20% growth in Dec quarter
items.summary: The Indian alcohol industry is celebrating strong festive season sales.  Nearly double-digit growth has been recorded.  The industry anticipates a further 20 percent rise in sales for the October to December period.  This surge is largely fueled by demand for premium spirits.  This positive trend is expected to continue through Christmas and New Year celebrations.

items.title: Skill financing scheme, Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Mudra Yojana, likely to be unveiled in Budget
items.summary: India is set to launch the Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Mudra Yojana (PMKMY) in the upcoming Budget 2026-27, a five-year scheme to fund workforce skilling. This initiative aims to provide broader access to high-end training, particularly for emerging sectors, and ensure resources reach women, rural youth, and persons with disabilities.

items.title: Chinese envoy hails "very important day" as India-China direct flights resume after 5 years on Kolkata-Guangzhou route
items.summary: Direct flights between India and China have resumed. The Kolkata to Guangzhou route is now operational after a five-year break. This marks a significant improvement in bilateral relations. IndiGo operates the daily non-stop service. The resumption is seen as a positive step for business and tourism. This initiative is expected to boost connectivity between the two nations.

items.title: Homebuyers’ body flags key gaps in RERA, seeks stronger protection for buyers
items.summary: A homebuyers' association has urged the Union housing ministry to address critical RERA Act gaps, citing ongoing buyer exploitation. The firm reiterated its preference for large-cap and low-volatility stocks, which it views as the “cheapest” styles relative to the market and beneficiaries of strong earnings tailwinds.
